result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelli L. St. Germaine

defendant.name: St. Germaine, Kelli L.
defendant.address: 200 Chippewa Street, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Anne M. Katte in court for Kelli L. St. Germaine.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 20CF72, 20CF164, 22CF81 and 22CM6. Victim rights complied with 22CM6. No victim appearing. Defense gave Court the plea questionnaire and a waiver of rights form. Court reads the plea agreement.  Defendant pleads guilty to the four counts listed in plea agreement on the plea questionnaire. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty in 22CM6 count 1, 20CF72 count 1, count 2 dismissed and read in, 22CF81 count 2 and count 3 as to 20CF164 all counts are dismissed and read in. 
State speaks to sentencing. Attorney Katte speaks to the joint recommendation and requests a minor change by not assessing any additional jail time. Defense requests treatment in lieu of conditional jail time. Defendant makes a statement to the court. Felony advisements given. 

Court imposes - 
22CM06: 90 days jail IMPOSED AND STAYED and one year probation. Consecutive jail sentences. Full restitution paid to victim in the amount of $71.50, payable within 60 days to the Clerk of Court's Office. Probation with AODA and treatment, mental health evaluation and treatment, employment, and other programming as deemed necessary by agent. Probation concurrent.
20CF72: 9 months jail IMPOSED AND STAYED and two years probation. Probation with AODA and treatment, mental health evaluation and treatment, employment, and other programming as deemed necessary by agent.
22CF81: 6 months jail on felony matter, 30 days jail concurrent misdemeanor charge IMPOSED AND STAYED and two years of probation. Court notes credit of 119 days.  Probation with AODA and treatment, mental health evaluation and treatment, employment, and other programming as deemed necessary by agent, 120 conditional jail time STAYED - report to inpatient treatment within 45 days of today.  Review hearing in 90 days. If reported as required and successfully completed the 120 days will not have to served. 
20CF164: Court dismisses and read in entire case.

DNA sample is required.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:08 PM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anne M. Katte appeared by video for Kelli L. St. Germaine.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense confirms receipt of criminal complaint. Waive reading.  Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-files information and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Defense motions to modify bond to attend in patient treatment.  Court requests motion to modify bond be heard when specifics are in place for treatment dates.  Court will consider it by stipulation or prompt hearing.  Bond continued.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:26 AM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne M. Katte not in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Katte contacted the court and was unavailable to appear this morning.  Cases are assigned to Judge Klein and attorneys need to contact Judge Klein's Judicial Assistant to schedule hearings.  Bond continued.

1:50 PM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anne M. Katte not in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Case to be reassigned due to conflict.  Defendant advised to call the PD Office to have Attorney Katte appointed to new matter.  Bond continued.  Next hearing set for status of counsel as well as potential AIA.
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
11:39 AM Defendant Kelli L. St. Germaine in court, in custody without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Katte has not yet been appointed to this case.  Defendant confirms receipt of complaint.  Disqualification to occur in this case.  Application for specific judicial assignment to be completed. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel. ADA Hayes appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  Defendant advised to contact public defender's office.  Bond set at $2,000 Cash. Bond form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:15 am.
